results.title: Cardiovascular outcome in 12-month-old male and female offspring of metformin-treated obese mice.
results.text_hl: Maternal @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ was not corrective and introduced further sex-dependent @<m>DISEASE_Cardiovascular_Abnormalities</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018376 @@@cardiovascular alterations@@@.

citations.NLM: Schoonejans JM, Wilsmore P, Mennitti LV, Wong KK, Ashmore TJ, Garrud TAC, Blackmore HL, Patey OV, Fernandez-Twinn DS, Giussani DA, Ozanne SE. Cardiovascular outcome in 12-month-old male and female offspring of metformin-treated obese mice. J Physiol. 2025 Jun 19;():. PMID: 40538089

results.title: Identification and validation of metformin protects against PM2.5-induced macrophages cytotoxicity by targeting toll like receptor pathway.
results.text_hl: Fine particle matter (PM2.5) has been extensively reported to contribute to the pathogenesis of @DISEASE_Lung_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D008171 @@@pulmonary diseases@@@. Recently, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ has been reported to attenuate PM2.5 associated @<m>DISEASE_Cardiovascular_Abnormalities</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018376 @@@respiratory and cardiovascular injury@@@, but the underling mechanism has not been discovered.

citations.NLM: Shi Y, Batibawa JW, Maiga M, Sun B, Li Y, Duan J, Sun Z. Identification and validation of metformin protects against PM2.5-induced macrophages cytotoxicity by targeting toll like receptor pathway. Chemosphere. 2020 Jul;251():126526. PMID: 32443237
citations.BibTeX: @article{32443237, title={Identification and validation of metformin protects against PM2.5-induced macrophages cytotoxicity by targeting toll like receptor pathway.}, author={Shi Y and Batibawa JW and Maiga M and Sun B and Li Y and Duan J and Sun Z}, journal={Chemosphere}, volume={251}, pages={126526}}

results.title: Diosmetin attenuates metabolic syndrome and left ventricular alterations via the suppression of angiotensin II/AT1 receptor/gp91phox/p-NF-kappaB protein expression in high-fat diet fed rats.
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@Inflammation@@@ indicated by an increased phospho nuclear factor kappa B (p-NF-kappaB) protein expression and cardiac @GENE_TNF @GENE_24835 @@@TNF-alpha@@@ concentration was reduced in @DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@MS@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ receiving @CHEMICAL_diosmetin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C039602 @@@diosmetin@@@ (p < 0.05). @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ also attenuated @DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@MS@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Cardiovascular_Abnormalities</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018376 @@@cardiac abnormalities@@@ relevant to decreasing the @GENE_REN @GENE_24715 @@@renin@@@-angiotensin system stimulation, @CHEMICAL_Reactive_Oxygen_Species @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017382 @@@reactive oxygen species@@@ and @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@ in @DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@MS@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ (p < 0.05).

citations.NLM: Meephat S, Prasatthong P, Rattanakanokchai S, Bunbupha S, Maneesai P, Pakdeechote P. Diosmetin attenuates metabolic syndrome and left ventricular alterations via the suppression of angiotensin II/AT1 receptor/gp91phox/p-NF-kappaB protein expression in high-fat diet fed rats. Food Funct. 2021 Mar 1;12(4):1469-1481. PMID: 33449987
citations.BibTeX: @article{33449987, title={Diosmetin attenuates metabolic syndrome and left ventricular alterations via the suppression of angiotensin II/AT1 receptor/gp91phox/p-NF-kappaB protein expression in high-fat diet fed rats.}, author={Meephat S and Prasatthong P and Rattanakanokchai S and Bunbupha S and Maneesai P and Pakdeechote P}, journal={Food Funct}, volume={12}, number={4}, pages={1469-1481}}

results.title: Evidence-based and potential benefits of metformin in the polycystic ovary syndrome: a comprehensive review.
results.text_hl: In particular, we will analyze the uses of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ not only for the treatment of all @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@-related disturbances such as @DISEASE_Dysmenorrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D004412 @@@menstrual disorders@@@, @DISEASE_Infertility @DISEASE_MESH:D007246 @@@anovulatory infertility@@@, increased @DISEASE_Abortion_Habitual @DISEASE_MESH:D000026 @@@abortion@@@, or complicated pregnancy risk, @DISEASE_Hyperandrogenism @DISEASE_MESH:D017588 @@@hyperandrogenism@@@, endometrial, @<m>DISEASE_Cardiovascular_Abnormalities</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018376 @@@metabolic and cardiovascular abnormalities@@@, but also for the prevention of the syndrome.

citations.NLM: Palomba S, Falbo A, Zullo F, Orio F Jr. Evidence-based and potential benefits of metformin in the polycystic ovary syndrome: a comprehensive review. Endocr Rev. 2009 Feb;30(1):1-50. PMID: 19056992
citations.BibTeX: @article{19056992, title={Evidence-based and potential benefits of metformin in the polycystic ovary syndrome: a comprehensive review.}, author={Palomba S and Falbo A and Zullo F and Orio F Jr}, journal={Endocr Rev}, volume={30}, number={1}, pages={1-50}}

results.title: Beneficial effects of strategies for primary prevention of diabetes on cardiovascular risk factors: results of the Indian Diabetes Prevention Programme.
results.text_hl: At follow-up, prevalence of @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ (BP > or = 130/> or = 85 mmHg) had increased significantly in all groups. @<m>DISEASE_Cardiovascular_Abnormalities</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018376 @@@Cardiovascular abnormalities@@@ were lower in intervention groups, with the lowest rates in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ group (p=0.013 vs. control); the LDL-C level decreased in intervention groups.

citations.NLM: Snehalatha C, Mary S, Joshi VV, Ramachandran A. Beneficial effects of strategies for primary prevention of diabetes on cardiovascular risk factors: results of the Indian Diabetes Prevention Programme. Diab Vasc Dis Res. 2008 Mar;5(1):25-9. PMID: 18398809
citations.BibTeX: @article{18398809, title={Beneficial effects of strategies for primary prevention of diabetes on cardiovascular risk factors: results of the Indian Diabetes Prevention Programme.}, author={Snehalatha C and Mary S and Joshi VV and Ramachandran A}, journal={Diab Vasc Dis Res}, volume={5}, number={1}, pages={25-9}}
